title: How to Buy Crafts for Kids

steps.headline: Buy crafts that are appropriate for your child's age level.
Consider the safety and use of the materials to make the craft.
Examine the ability required to complete the project.
Think about the child's likes and dislikes when buying crafts.
Ask the child his or her own crafting method preference.
Focus on what will happen to the craft before and after it is completed.

text:
Evaluating Age Appropriateness Buy crafts that are appropriate for your child's age level. For example, sticker foam crafts are more suitable for young children. Painting, beading and clay are good choices for older children. Sewing and model building are best for teenagers. Selecting age-appropriate crafts that children are capable of successfully completing will build self-esteem. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Many crafts will list an age range on the box. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Consider the safety and use of the materials to make the craft. Small children do not need projects containing small items such as beads. They can easily choke on small materials. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Older children can handle permanent markers, oil pastels, glitter and pottery wheels more safely and with less chaos, confusion and mess than younger children. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":332,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":548.0769230769231,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Items that state "non-toxic" on the package are best. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Healthier choices include white glue and glue sticks over rubber cement (with hexane or heptane), tempera paints and poster paints rather than spray or acrylic paints (containing ammonia,formaldehyde and acrylonitrile butadiene styrene plastic), homemade, earth-based or flour-based clays instead of polymer clays (made of vinyl or PVC) and washable markers, crayons and colored pencils in the place of dry-erase markers (with alcohol or ketone). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Examine the ability required to complete the project. Refrain from buying crafts for small children that take great concentration and detail. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Younger children should not be asked to complete projects that are physically demanding or make great use of fine motor skills, such as stringing small beads. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/90/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/90/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Gauging What is Age Appropriate Think about the child's likes and dislikes when buying crafts. Making art should not be a chore for the child. Children should enjoy completing the project. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Girls may find making bracelets and designing bags fun while boys may enjoy building cars and wood crafts. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.9120879120879,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Ask the child his or her own crafting method preference. A child will take more pride in the craft if he or she has a choice in the type of work that is purchased. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Some children love to paint. Others like clay or bead work. Buy crafts that match the child's art creation interests. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-5Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/91/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-5Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Considering Storage of the Craft Focus on what will happen to the craft before and after it is completed. You'll want to choose crafts you can easily store before and during the work. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Also think about what you will do with the craft after it is complete. Will it serve a purpose, such as a refrigerator magnet, or end up thrown in the trash? {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Buy-Crafts-for-Kids-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Finished.
